ci_support_linux_64_cuda_compiler_versio:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cuda_compiler:
- cuda-nvcc
cuda_compiler_version:
- '12.9'
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
pybind11_abi:
- '11'
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - cxx_compiler_version
  - c_stdlib_version
  - cuda_compiler_version

about.description:
HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit, implementing molecular
dynamics and hard particle Monte Carlo optimized for fast execution on both GPUs and
CPUs. As a Python package, HOOMD-blue gives you the flexibility to create custom
initialization routines, control simulation parameters, perform in situ analysis,
use interactive notebooks, and more.
about.summary: HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit.

use interactive notebooks, and more.
about.summary: HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit.

name: hoomd

about.description:
HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit, implementing molecular
dynamics and hard particle Monte Carlo optimized for fast execution on both GPUs and
CPUs. As a Python package, HOOMD-blue gives you the flexibility to create custom
initialization routines, control simulation parameters, perform in situ analysis,
use interactive notebooks, and more.
about.summary: HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit.

about.description:
HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit, implementing molecular
dynamics and hard particle Monte Carlo optimized for fast execution on both GPUs and
CPUs. As a Python package, HOOMD-blue gives you the flexibility to create custom
initialization routines, control simulation parameters, perform in situ analysis,
use interactive notebooks, and more.
about.summary: HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit.

raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: "hoomd"
  version: "6.1.1"
  processor: ${{ "gpu" if cuda_compiler_version != "None" else "cpu" }}
  number: 0

package:
  name: ${{ name }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/glotzerlab/hoomd-blue/releases/download/v${{ version }}/${{ name }}-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 4e645f343b84b02bc099b65d5b7b0575e15496b53500def31a3d827df0133da8
  patches:
    - "fix-python-site-dir.patch"

build:
  number: ${{ number }}
  string: ${{ processor }}_py${{ python | version_to_buildstring }}_h${{ hash }}_${{ number }}
  script: bash ${RECIPE_DIR}/build_hoomd.sh ${{ processor }}
  skip: win

requirements:
  run_exports:
    - ${{ pin_subpackage('hoomd', upper_bound='x.x.x') }}
  build:
    - ${{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - ${{ stdlib("c") }}
    - cmake
    - ninja
    - pkg-config
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - python
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
        - numpy
        - pybind11 >=2.12.0
    - if: cuda_compiler_version != "None"
      then: ${{ compiler('cuda') }}

  host:
    - eigen
    - numpy
    - pybind11 >=2.12.0
    - python
    - pybind11-abi
    - if: cuda_compiler_version != "None"
      then:
        - cuda-version ==${{ cuda_compiler_version }}
        - cuda-cudart-dev
        - cuda-driver-dev
        - cuda-nvrtc-dev
        - cuda-profiler-api
        - libcublas-dev
        - libcufft-dev
        - libcusolver-dev
        - libcusparse-dev

  run:
    - python
    - if: cuda_compiler_version != "None"
      then:
        - __cuda >=${{ cuda_compiler_version }}
        - ${{ pin_compatible("cuda-version", upper_bound="x", lower_bound="x") }}

tests:
  - script:
      - pytest --pyargs hoomd -v
    requirements:
      run:
        - pytest
        - rowan


about:
  homepage: https://glotzerlab.engin.umich.edu/hoomd-blue/
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit.

  description: |
    HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit, implementing molecular
    dynamics and hard particle Monte Carlo optimized for fast execution on both GPUs and
    CPUs. As a Python package, HOOMD-blue gives you the flexibility to create custom
    initialization routines, control simulation parameters, perform in situ analysis,
    use interactive notebooks, and more.

  documentation: https://hoomd-blue.readthedocs.io
  repository: https://github.com/glotzerlab/hoomd-blue/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - joaander
    - tcmoore3
    - SchoeniPhlippsn
    - DomFijan
    - janbridley
    - tfteague
    - sumitavaumich
